channel.title: Cookie Management
channel.description:
I can't find any documentation on the process by which cookies are accepted and used.
This is what I am doing:
Client opens connection with server Client specifies the stored cookies (if any) and basic headers Client flushes Server responds with Set-Cookie headers Client interprets Set-Cookie headers and stores them in flat files Client closes connection with server Client opens connection with server Client specifies the newly stored cookies (if any) and basic headers Client flushes Server responds with Set-Cookie headers and a body Client prints out body Client closes connection with server etc..........
So the client has to effectively open a connection twice to receive and set the cookies. Is this right, or is there a way to somehow magically send some extra header data once the response has been received?

What you talkin bout willis?

The client makes an HTTP request, the server sends cookies in an HTTP response, and all subsequent client HTTP requests will have those cookies, until the cookies expire.
